My research goal is to make visual systems intelligent, fair and robust.

Research Projects

ViT-Insight: Vision Attention Explorer
Umair Hassan

This project visualizes attention maps and computes Attention Rollout for Vision Transformer (ViT) models. It helps interpret how information flows across layers, heads, and tokens (especially [CLS]) and allows interactive exploration per image, per label, and per layer.
Valorant Object Detection with Google PaliGemma
Umair Hassan
Model Weights

This project fine-tunes Googleâ€™s PaliGemma vision-language model for object detection in Valorant gameplay, demonstrating competency in low-resource adaptation and 4-bit QLoRA quantization. It benchmarks pretrained versus fine-tuned performance, achieving a 61 percent mAP improvement with notable gains in small-object detection. Trained weights are publicly available on Hugging Face to enable reproducibility and community experimentation.
